sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine war and peace on the agenda as Vladimir Putin welcomes Chinese President Xi Jinping to the Kremlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The president of the European Central Bank says that they are ready to preserve as necessary the Eurozone stability as fallout from the Swiss banking crisis continues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The EU and international donors pledge 7 billion euro to Turkey and Syria following devastating earthquakes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The European Union approves a deal worth 2 billion euros to buy and deliver ammunition for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At a time when he has few friends on the international stage, Vladimir Putin welcomed Chinese President Xi Jinping to the Kremlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The visit sends a powerful message to Western leaders allied with Ukraine that efforts to isolate Russia and its president have fallen short. and your initiative, to which we are certainly respectful. We are always open to a negotiation process. While Putin has signalled he's prepared to discuss Ukraine, the visit may also be a pretext to appeal to China for weapons and ammunition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It seems European stock markets are reacting well to the Swiss banking deal, which will

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: see investment bank UBS acquire its longtime rival Credit Suisse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: After reversing initial losses, European banking shares turned black again on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Policymakers throughout the continent also welcomed the emergency takeover as a decisive step to support the financial system and reassure markets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Speaking at a committee hearing in the European Parliament in Brussels, the head of the European Central Bank, Christine Lagarde, praised the latest decision by Swiss authorities as instrumental in restoring orderly market conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: She says that worries the troubles from credit Swiss could spill over into the Euro area are unfounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We are monitoring market developments closely and stand ready to respond as necessary to preserve price stability and financial stability in the Euro area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Euro area banking sector is resilient with strong capital and liquidity positions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: In a coordinated bid, the ECB together with six other Western central banks also announced they would maintain available cash throughout the global financial system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The move came hot on the heels of the European Central Bank's decision to raise interest rates by 0.5 points.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: A big hike that came as a surprise to some observers, but considered appropriate by Lagarde.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The German government also echoed her comments. Credit Suisse has become the latest and most important casualty of a crisis of confidence that has already seen the failure of two mid-sized U.S. banks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: As Switzerland's second biggest lender, it was considered one of the top 30 most important banks in the world, which is why this takeover was rushed through by the Swiss authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Seven billion euros to support those picking up the pieces of the devastation left by the recent earthquakes in Turkey and Syria, the big promise made by the international community in Brussels Monday. The challenge now, make sure donors follow up and get the money to those who need it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: We have to start with the most basic thing. Can we actually bring back some hope? Because remember there is 600,000 housing units that have been destroyed, 900 schools just in Turkey, these are the figures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: People have lost their livelihoods literally within seconds and many people are still internally displaced living in tents, living with relatives in container villages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The February 6th earthquakes were the worst natural disaster to hit the region in recent history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Over 56,000 people died. On top of that, torrential floods have left many without their temporary accommodation. For its part, the European Commission has put 1 billion euros on the table. It says it's confident the money will be mobilised fast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I'm also very happy that this is not just academic support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is real support that will be delivered quick on the ground, that will build back schools, hospitals, that will build back infrastructure and this should bring back jobs and growth to the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Brussels' ties with Ankara have been tense for years and most recently, Turkey has been holding up a bid by Sweden to join NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But in the room on Monday, it was diplomacy prevailing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Well, you know, trouble brings the people together.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So I think if this earthquake has any positive element, if that is the improvement of our relationship, it's only the better.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We care and we are here to help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Many thanks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The E.U. will host a follow-up conference to support Syria this June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Naeem McMahon, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The European Union is allocating two billion euros towards buying and delivering ammunition to Ukraine, following an agreement in Brussels on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The decision came after EU foreign affairs ministers approved a three-phase plan to provide Ukraine with at least one million artillery shells and to replenish supplies throughout the bloc, some of which are running worryingly low. The question now is whether the European Defence Agency or EU countries will negotiate the orders, and also if they should buy from just European producers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Fifteen member states want to go through the bloc's defense agency, while Germany says it's willing to open up its procurement process to other EU countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Estonia's defense minister is clear, though.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: In 12 months' time, the process must be completed one way or another.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We prefer to get it from the European industry, but Estonia has been always very open to that question.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: We have ordered ourselves also from the third countries and we see clearly that if there is a need for a quick delivery, then all the options have to be on the table, all the options have to be open in order to help ukraine the issue will be discussed later this week in brussels at an eu leaders summit ukraine is well positioned to regain the initiative and launch

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: counter-offensives in critical sectors of the current front lines, says the Institute for the Study of War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Adding that ongoing Russian offensive along the Svatovo-Kriminna line around Bakhmut and along the Avdiivka-Donetsk city and Vuhledar front lines have failed to make more than incremental tactical gains in 2023.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: more than incremental tactical gains in 2023.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian forces likely conducted a localized counterattack southwest of Bakhmut amid growing Russian discussion about the potential Ukrainian counteroffensives in this area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Institute for the Study of War says Russia has committed the approximately 300,000 mobilized soldiers called up by partial mobilization in September last year for the purpose of pursuing exactly such a spring offensive to this various offensive efforts now if 300,000 Russian soldiers have been unable to give Russia a decisive offensive edge in Ukraine it is highly unlikely that the commitment of additional forces in future mobilization waves will produce a dramatically different outcome this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Another evidence the UK Defense Ministry says on the 3rd of March authorities in the Russian control part of the Zaporizhia region published a decree that declares occupied Melitopol as the regional capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia has never occupied Zaporizhia city, a major industrial center of 700,000 people, which is approximately 35 kilometers from the current front line. The quiet declaration of an alternative capital is likely acknowledgement within the Russian system that its forces are highly unlikely to cease previously planned major objectives in the near future. Now, the tempo of Russian offensive operations across the theater has slowed down in recent weeks, suggesting that the Russian offensive in Donbass may be nearing culmination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A smiling and understandably emotional Olivier Dubois, a French journalist,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: has been freed almost two years after his kidnapping by jihadists in Mali.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He arrived at Naomi Airport in Niger on Monday alongside Jeffrey Woodka, an American humanitarian worker who's been held hostage since 2016.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Dubois, a freelance journalist, was kidnapped on the 8th of April 2021 by jihadists linked to al-Qaeda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The White House said it was relieved the hostages had been released.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: After speaking to Dubois by telephone, French President Emmanuel Macron expressed his immense relief and his great gratitude for what he called this liberation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Humanity is on thin ice and that ice is melting fast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The United Nations Secretary General has called on wealthy countries to bring forward their goals of achieving carbon neutrality as close as possible to 2040.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Antonio Guterres says the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change report on global warming is a toolbox for a better future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Everything, everywhere, all at once.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In real life, not only the movies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The climate time bomb is ticking.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But today's IPCC report is a how-to guide to defuse the climate time bomb.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It is a survival guide for humanity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As it shows, the 1.5 degree limit is achievable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But it will take a quantum leap in climate action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Stepping up his pleas for action on fossil fuels, Guterres not only called for no new coal, but also for eliminating its use in rich countries by 2030 and poor countries by 2040.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He urged carbon-free electricity generation in the developed world by 2035, meaning no gas-fired power plants either.
